clinical_study.brief_title: Follow-Up After Surgical Treatment of Peri-implantitis
clinical_study.official_title: Follow-Up After Surgical Treatment of Peri-implantitis

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this prospective clinical study was to evaluate the 3-year outcomes of anti-infective surgical treatment of peri-implantitis when a regular supportive peri-implant therapy (SPIT) programme was followed.

detailed_description.textblock:
The patients enrolled in this prospective study all received surgical treatment for peri-implantitis at one of 2 treatment centres (specialist periodontal practice, Molndal and Gothenburg, Public Dental Health Services, Region Vastra Gotaland, Sweden) and were enrolled between October 2010 and December 2013.). All were treated by experienced periodontists.
Details of the peri-implantitis treatment protocol have been described in a previous publication reporting on the 12-month clinical and radiographic treatment outcomes, registered at ClinicalTrials.gov (NCT01857804) and approved by the Regional Ethical Committee, Gothenburg, Sweden (Dnr. 654-10).

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in treatment success at 3 years post-op
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline (1 year post-op) and 3 years post-op
primary_outcome.description: treatment success is defined by pocket closure, no bleeding on probing, bone loss ≤0.5 mm between baseline and 3 years

arm_group.description: all patients who received surgical treatment for peri-implantitis during a Randomized and Controlled Trial registered in ClinicalTrials.gov NCT NCT01857804

intervention.description: Examination 3 years after surgical treatment of peri-implantitis

study_pop.textblock: all patients who received surgical treatment for peri-implantitis during the RCT registered in ClinicalTrials.gov NCT NCT01857804
